result.markdown: --- title: An Overview of htmlwidgets description: | A brief overview of htmlwidgets in R date: 2017-05-25 author: - name: Ella Kaye url: https://twitter.com/ellamkaye #site-url: https://ellakaye.rbind.io/ image: htmlwidgets-4.png # N.B. Don't use "" in image-alt #image-alt: | #categories: # - TAG_1 # - TAG_2 #twitter-card: # uncomment lines below for different title and description to post # title: | # description: | # uncomment for different image to post # image: | # image-alt: | # defaults to 500 x 500 summary: uncomment lines below for large card # image-width: 600 # image-height: 314 # card-style: "summary_large_image" draft: false --- ::: {.cell} ::: ` slides`{=html} ` materials`{=html} ## Overview The [`htmlwidgets`](http://www.htmlwidgets.org/index.html) package allows developers to create R bindings to JavaScript libraries. The resulting R packages allow the embedding of interactive content in R Markdown documents and Shiny web apps. There are over 50 available widgets. In this talk I give an overview of the `htmlwidget` framework and demonstrate the use of the [`DT`](https://rstudio.github.io/DT/), [`leaflet`](http://rstudio.github.io/leaflet/) and [`DiagrammeR`](http://rich-iannone.github.io/DiagrammeR/) packages. ## Event details **Event:** [Warwick R User Group](https://warwick.ac.uk/fac/sci/wdsi/events/wrug/) **Date:** May 25th, 2017 **Time:** 17:00 **Location:** University of Warwick ## Key points - Point 1 - Point 2 - ... ## Slides - fill in iframe and link in last bullet point Keyboard shortcuts for slideshow (once you've clicked inside it): - Use ← and → to navigate through the slides. - Use o for an overview of all slides. - Use h to see a list of other shortcuts - f to toggle full screen not working, but the rest are fine. - For full screen slides, go to [slides]("") then press f.
